Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides a list of the best language learning apps and a brief description of each app, but it does not provide detailed user reviews or information about the features of each app. The author notes that the best language learning apps are economical, offer speech recognition, and cater to different learning styles and schedules. The text primarily discusses the use of cookies and similar technologies to improve user experience and provides options to manage cookies through the "Cookie Settings" button.

Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The article reviews five language learning apps: Babbel, Busuu Premium Plus, Memrise, Rosetta Stone, and Super Duolingo. The apps were tested for ease of setup, design, and features offered. Rosetta Stone was found to be the best language learning app overall due to its easy-to-use design and logical lesson format. The article provides a detailed description of the testing process and features of each app. Busuu Premium Plus is described as better for learners with prior exposure to the language, but with constant offers to spend more money. Memrise uses short videos and requires more focus and typing, but offers more advanced vocabulary. Super Duolingo takes small steps in learning and offers virtual celebrations for correct answers, making it fast and easy to use. Each app offers lessons in multiple languages and can be used as a web or mobile app. The prices for each app's subscription plans are also provided. 
 
 Links: [' (https://www.cnn.com/cnn-underscored/reviews/best-language-learning-apps#maincontent)', '
